Capstone
SPARC Open Education Leadership Program

My Capstone completed the 2020–2021 SPARC Open Education Leadership Program. The Capstone is comprised of numerous resources related to Open Educational Resource (OER) instruction and advocacy at a small liberal arts college:

  • The Final Report
    • "A Way to Start Supporting OER at a Small Liberal Arts College"
      • This report outlines what I did for my capstone project, why I did it, and how I did it; what goals I met and where I fell short; and recommendations for others starting to develop OER at small liberal arts colleges and libraries.
  • The Community Resources
    • Open Educational Resources LibGuide
      • In the five months since its publication in March 2021, my OER LibGuide has been the fifth most viewed Union College LibGuide (out of 79 LibGuides).
    • Lecture / Presentation Slides: Introduction to OER for Librarians
      • My Intro to OER presentation to Schaffer librarians helped build a library-wide OER discourse and possibly a Library OER committee to advance Library OER support.
    • Lecture / Presentation Slides: Introduction to OER for Student Government
      • My Intro to OER presentation to Union's student government inaugurated the first Schaffer Library—student government OER partnership.
    • A Survey of Students on Course Material Costs and Concerns
      • The student course material costs survey emerged from a partnership that I established between Schaffer Library, the Student Forum, and the Union College Bookstore, and it sought to gather information about the need for OER at Union.
      • The survey received 329 student responses, over 16% of students; the results showed the urgent need for course materials to be made more affordable, thus providing helpful data to make the case for OER to faculty; and it solidified a partnership between the Library, student government, and Bookstore.
      • All of this was entirely new for my Library: it had never before conducted a campus survey, nor had it ever partnered with our student government or our bookstore.
